is.ru.honn.rutube.service

Class VideoServiceStub

  • java.lang.Object
    • is.ru.honn.rutube.service.VideoServiceStub
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    VideoService

    public class VideoServiceStub
extends java.lang.Object
implements VideoService
    Version:
    1.0, 28/09/16. This class contains a setter function for the user list as well as getter functions where you can either get a video by requested video id or get all videos from a certain user by requested user id. The class also contains the addVideo function which adds a video to the video list.
    Author:
    Steinar Marinó Hilmarsson and Egill Gautur Steingrímsson.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      VideoServiceStub(java.util.List<User> list)
      Setter function for the list of users.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int addVideo(Video video, int userId)
      This function adds a video to the video list and returns the size of the list or throws an exception.
      Video getVideo(int videoId)
      This functions gets a video by requested video id or throws an exception if either the list of users is empty (if there are no users then there are no videos) or if the requested id does not match with any of the videos.
      java.util.List<Video> getVideosbyUser(int userId)
      This functions gets videos of a single user by requested user id or throws an exception if the requested id does not match with any of the users.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • VideoServiceStub

        public VideoServiceStub(java.util.List<User> list)
        Setter function for the list of users.

        list - The list of users.

    • Method Detail

      • addVideo

        public int addVideo(Video video,
                    int userId)
             throws ServiceException
        This function adds a video to the video list and returns the size of the list or throws an exception. Exception is thrown if the user list is either empty (If there are no users then you cannot add a video) or if the requested id does not match any user. Exception is also thrown if some attributes are in use. Those include the id, source or title.
        Specified by:
        addVideo in interface VideoService
        Parameters:
        video - The video.
        userId - The id of user.
        Returns:
        The size of the video list.
        Throws:
        ServiceException - throws exception if id, source or title was in use. It also throws exception if there are no user in the list or if there is no user with this id.

      • getVideo

        public Video getVideo(int videoId)
               throws ServiceException
        This functions gets a video by requested video id or throws an exception if either the list of users is empty (if there are no users then there are no videos) or if the requested id does not match with any of the videos.
        Specified by:
        getVideo in interface VideoService
        Parameters:
        videoId - The id of video.
        Returns:
        The video with requested id.
        Throws:
        ServiceException - Throws exception if there are no users or if there was no video with that particular id.

      • getVideosbyUser

        public java.util.List<Video> getVideosbyUser(int userId)
                                      throws ServiceException
        This functions gets videos of a single user by requested user id or throws an exception if the requested id does not match with any of the users.
        Specified by:
        getVideosbyUser in interface VideoService
        Parameters:
        userId - The id of user.
        Returns:
        The list of videos of requested user.
        Throws:
        ServiceException - Throws exception if there was no user with this particular id.
